game.engine.image.sprite

Class InvertedSprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.engine.image.sprite.InvertedSprite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sprite

    public class InvertedSprite
extends Object
implements Sprite
    Sprite that uses another sprite and inverts the coordinates. Now the first frame is the last etc.
    Mirroring is also supported.
    Author:
    Marvin Bruns

    • Constructor Detail

      • InvertedSprite

        public InvertedSprite(DefaultSprite sprite,
                      boolean X,
                      boolean Y,
                      boolean mirror)
        Parameters:
        sprite - DefaultSprite used for this sprite
        X - if true X-Axis is inverted
        Y - if true Y-Axis is inverted
        mirror - if true the X, Y parameters are used for mirroring. Otherwise coordinates will be inverted.

      • InvertedSprite

        public InvertedSprite(DefaultSprite sprite,
                      boolean invertX,
                      boolean invertY,
                      boolean mirrorX,
                      boolean mirrorY)
        Parameters:
        sprite - DefaultSprite used for this sprite
        invertX - if true X-Axis is inverted
        invertY - if true Y-Axis is inverted
        mirrorX - if true the tiles will be mirrored in X direction (left-right)
        mirrorY - if true the tiles will be mirrored in Y direction (top-bottom)

    • Method Detail

      • drawTile

        public void drawTile(Graphics2D g,
                     int x,
                     int y,
                     int width,
                     int height)
        Description copied from interface: Sprite
        Draws a tile of this sprite. The tile is drawn with Bounds(0, 0, width, height). Consider creating a clipped Graphics2D object.
        Specified by:
        drawTile in interface Sprite
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics2D object to draw on
        x - X-Coordinate of the tile
        y - Y-Coordinate of the tile
        width - The width of the Graphics object to draw on
        height - The height of the Graphics object to draw on

      • getTile

        public BufferedImage getTile(int x,
                             int y)
        Description copied from interface: Sprite
        Get a tile of this sprite. Be careful with this method. Creates a copy of the underlying tile.
        Use Sprite.drawTile(Graphics2D, int, int, int, int) for faster action and less memory usage.
        Specified by:
        getTile in interface Sprite
        Parameters:
        x - X-Coordinate of the tile
        y - Y-Coordinate of the tile
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage containing the tile

        Description copied from interface: Sprite
